questions.title: Two Sum
questions.description:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return the indices of the two numbers that add up to target.

You may assume that each input has exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.
questions.inputFormat:
First line: Integer n (array length)
Second line: n space-separated integers (array elements)
Third line: Integer target
questions.outputFormat: Two space-separated integers representing the indices of the two numbers

starterCode.python:
def twoSum(nums, target):

    pass

# Input parsing
n = int(input())
nums = list(map(int, input().split()))
target = int(input())

result = twoSum(nums, target)
print(' '.join(map(str, result)))

questions.title: Reverse a String
questions.description:
Given a string s, return the string reversed.

Do this without using any built-in string reversal functions.
questions.inputFormat: A single line containing the string to be reversed

testCases.explanation: Palindrome remains the same when reversed

starterCode.python:

s = input().strip()
result = reverseString(s)
print(result)

questions.title: Palindrome Check
questions.description:
Given a string s, determine if it is a palindrome, considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.

A palindrome is a word, phrase, number, or other sequence of characters that reads the same backward as forward.
constraints: s consists of printable ASCII characters
questions.inputFormat: A single line containing the string to check
questions.outputFormat: true if the string is a palindrome, false otherwise

testCases.input: A man, a plan, a canal: Panama
testCases.explanation: After removing non-alphanumeric chars and ignoring case: 'amanaplanacanalpanama' is a palindrome
After processing: 'raceacar' is not a palindrome
